title: unexpected panic in rustc

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

body:
I can't show just a snippet of code to crash rustc but I made an special branch in my project with (what I think) is the minimum code required to crash rustc.

This is the full version of the code: ludat/lurri@2ec32237c50b45c84d18f9dc22e008f8187d6724
This is the trimmed down version: ludat/lurri@f0536dd44f2a2cf7ce5751b06d47539ef7c03265

I suspect that the culprit is the expansion of the `piece` macro in the pattern matching in [`src/game.rs` in line 11](https://github.com/ludat/lurri/blob/rustc-crash-1/src/game.rs#L11)

Also [here](https://travis-ci.org/ludat/lurri/builds/72805373) is the travis build failing

I expected to see this happen: not to crash

Instead, this happened: crashed
## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc 1.3.0-nightly (be23d44a5 2015-07-20)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: be23d44a539deff16170d2af8fa10fb1cecc6a01
commit-date: 2015-07-20
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.3.0-nightly
```
